In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Sure, here's the implementation of the `wrap_string` function in Julia:
```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width=10)
    words = split(text, ' ')
    wrapped_lines = ""

    current_line = ""
    for word in words
        if widthof(current_line * " ") + widthof(word) > text_width
            # Wrap to new line
            wrapped_lines *= current_line * "\n"
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " " * word
        end
    end

    # Add last line, if any
    wrapped_lines *= current_line * "\n"

    return wrapped_lines
end
```
Now let's provide an example usage of this function:
```julia
text = """
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.
Praesent ac urna sed lacus facilisis blandit. Aliquam at rhoncus."""
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 20)
println(wrapped_text)
```
This will output a wrapped version of the text with each line having a maximum width of 20 characters.
